div.p: S. D. I now submit the response of my father-in-law to Stancarus' book, as well as my own to Brentius' book, which I mentioned in my previous letters.
I send them not because I think you need them, but to declare my goodwill towards you in some way, and finally to be admonished by you in a brotherly manner, wherever we seem to have gone astray.
How concerned we are about Aurelia! May the Lord protect her! Our neighboring Swiss Papists are preparing to go to war in France again.
I pray to the Lord with the words of the prophet.
"Scatter, O Lord, the people who delight in war, and do not hand over the soul of your turtledove to the beast!"
Farewell, dearest brother in Christ. All of ours send you their warmest greetings, especially my sons, sons-in-law, relatives, and brothers.
May the Lord keep you safe with us for a long time! May our brothers be safe, especially Jonvill, to whom I sent money for books the day before yesterday.
To the most illustrious man, Mr. Johannes Calvin, the most faithful pastor of the church of Geneva, my honorable lord and dearest brother.
